result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Jonathan Dykstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Financial obligations imposed in Count four (4) of 22CF103 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Count one (1) of 21CF476.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Consecutive to: 21CF476 and any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Jonathan Dykstra

records.addlTxt: Per COC and Victim/Witness, restitution is paid in full.  Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect zero restitution.
Per letter from State, RSH set 7-26-22 at 9:30am removed from the calendar - State and counsel notified by email.
Per stipulation of counsel, restitution amended to $129.26 plus the 10% surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin Jonathan Dykstra in court, in custody.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Kevin Jonathan Dykstra.  Information received and reading waived, not guilty pleas entered; On a plea to Ct 4, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct 1, 2, 3; Guilty plea entered on Ct 4; Court finds def guilty on Ct. 4, on motion of the State Ct 1, 2, 3 are dismissed for read in and judgment of conviction is entered.
Restitution hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Restitution hearing on July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Nolan Jensen.  Defendant consents to video appearance.  Counsel's first appearance.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Atty. Jensen states that he may be appointed through State Public Defender.  If not, Court will set court appointed repayment terms.  Atty. Jensen requests 21CF476 be brought in with this case at next hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Absolute sobriety; No controlled substances without a valid prescription

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Gillion Parham.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Argument on bond.  Defendant has a deferred prosecution agreement felony matter pending in Branch 4 with a return date of February 2023.  Atty. Nolan Jensen is currently appointed on other case.  $750 cash bond set.  Court appoints Atty. Nolan Jensen.  Court holds open the repayment terms that the defendant shall reimburse Washington County.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with Atty. Jensen.  COURT TO ADDRESS repayment terms at next court date.  Hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
